content: On August 28, 1989, the Atlanta Braves experienced a thrilling moment when they faced the San Diego Padres. In this game, Braves pitcher Tom Glavine delivered a masterful performance, throwing a complete game and striking out 11 batters, leading the Braves to a 3-1 victory. This outing showcased Glavine's emerging dominance on the mound, as he would go on to become a key figure in the Braves' success throughout the 1990s.
